intro: Erodendrum longipenne, commonly known as the long-pinion eremobius, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, with a distinctive spurred structure on the petals. Erodendrum longipenne plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
